review_blob: Draft @ wrigleyville pub.  Nice hefe aroma, peach is present but not strong, overpowering or fake.  Straw to amber color.  Head disappears quickly
On draft at franklin tap in Chicago.  Nice ups with pretty heavy wood flavors.  Oak makes it pretty dry but vanilla noticeable as well.  Head fades quickly.

This is the beer that turned me on to craft beer years ago at Mad Mex.  I remember more hop bitterness behind porter elements.  Whether that is true or not many traditional porter elements are present here withouth the excessive sweetness growing in craft porters.  Aromas of nutty chocolate give way to raisin and soy flavor.  BTW love the raisins and soy sauce porter deScription.

Bottle opens with very distinct yeast aroma, almost cheesy and astringent.  Pours a very hazy golden with white fluffy head.  Opens with an interesting candy sugar/cascade bitterness.  Body is very clean with some light spice and fruit notes.  This is pretty tasty out of the bottle which recommends aging.  Probably a good idea to mellow the sweetness and biting hop flavor.
